title: Fluctuating Ping
body:
Since the latest patch, my ping has been VERY UNSTABLE. During gameplay, ping will spike to about 220ms, slowly go down to 80ms, then spike back up to 220ms and repeat that cycle for the entire game. Logs of Lag: http://logsoflag.com/#I3WyzJbMlpR

My internet outside of LoL is very fast and has little to no lag. Speedtest.net results: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5767181398

I have tried the following: Repairing the LoL Client, plugging directly into my router with an ethernet cable, creating a firewall exception to prevent LoL from jumping around servers, updating Windows 10 to the latest version 1607, and disabling Cortana.

Before patch 6.21 I would get constant ping of 50-80ms with no lag issues at all, and I am at a complete loss as to what the problem is. Please send help :(

replies.body: I appreciate the troubleshooting you've done so far, and it certainly sounds like something is causing you to have problems staying specifically connected to the game servers.  It's really important to go over every single step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure all possibilities are ruled out.  Let me know if that helps!

Hello Porocles,

I followed the instructions on the connection issues guide, but to no avail:

First, I ran the Hextech Repair Tool which changed a couple of settings. However, ping issues did not go away. For the rest of the connection issues guide:
Switch to a wired connection: Same ping issues as before
Firewall Troubleshooting: League is already an exception in my firewall
Configure your dns: I tried using both automatic DNS as well as the Google public ips, 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4
Packet Loss: ICSI Netalyzer Results http://n1.netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/restore/id=369839a0-13394-6a558338-dc4d-4057-93a9/rd
Packet Buffering: I was the only one on the wi-fi and no other programs were open, but there was still fluctuating ping
Port Forwarding: I port forwarded the reccomended ports and nothing changed
VPN and Proxy Usage: I do not use a proxy or vpn
Release/Renew IP and Flush DNS: For some reason I can not release or renew my ip, but I can flush the DNS, which does nothing.

Some additional measures I took to fix the problem:
-Turning off the Interrupt Moderation setting of my Local Area Connection
-Changing the channel my router was on
-Re-patching league

I don't think this is an issue with the LoL Client because running a ping test from lolping.org gives around the same widely fluctuating ping results.

I can get to a very good ping level at around 70 ms, but it just won't stay there T-T

Hopefully I can figure something out soon, getting quite discouraged :/

**I FIXED IT**

Network and Sharing Center > Change adapter settings > Right click your wireless connection adapter  > Properties > Configure... > Advanced tab

-802.11n Channel Width for band 2.4GHz and 5GHz: Changed from 20MHz only to Auto
-802.11n Mode: Enabled
-Roaming Aggressiveness: Medium

My ping is now 65ms for 99% of play time, with one or two ping spikes per game. Finally :' )
This actually helped solve my fluctuating ping problem :O Thanks dude :D

Corsair Utility Engine. Ended it, and my ping problems ended. So much time wasted troubleshooting LUL

I just started having similar issues a few days ago. My ping bounces around from 90-200 even when other devices are not in use. I have pinged the League of Legends server on another PC in my household, and it is running with consistent 82-88ms. Could this just be an issue with my PC? The game is playable, but is not as fun when you have to aim your Lux ult with your jumping ping in mind. I've wondered whether I should give Hextech Repair Tool another shot, but I'm still hung up on the fact the other computer (without League installed) is communicating with the server better than this one (with League installed). Forgive me if I'm missing something, my knowledge of this subject is severely limited. I have also pinged other sites like Google and come up with consistent 48-50ms, so it's leading me to think there is something off with the connection between League servers and my PC. I would really appreciate some pointers. Thanks!
